intro: Eriolopha rigida, commonly known as the rigid eriolopha, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Eriolopha rigida is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to survive in arid conditions.
